Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicology testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

Our Richmond, VA facility is currently seeking a Full-Time Technician I (Toxicology).

A Toxicology Laboratory Technician I is responsible for conducting aerosol exposure studies and analyzing data collected. The ideal candidate will have experience in working under possibly hazardous conditions (e.g. pathogens or chemicals). He/She will be well-trained to maintain safety conditions and will be passionate for doing work that makes things move forward.

Help conduct aerosol exposure studies for determining potential mutagenic, genotoxic and cytotoxic activity of complex mixtures or experimental test articles from various sources.
Analyze data collected in real time data and assess experimental progress
Follow study protocols and methods based on published scientific articles and technical reports.
Work with and without supervision to setup up instruments used in aerosol exposure studies and document experimental setups and results.
Operate, maintain and troubleshoot laboratory equipment and instruments
Conduct laboratory day-to-day duties, such as preparation of laboratory materials and solutions as well as housekeeping and ordering responsibilities
Assist in data compilation, review and interpretation.
Prepare summary of findings and observation
Work in a GLP compliant environment
Comply with Enthalpy’s Quality Assurance Program and other policies
Comply with Enthalpy’s Health and Safety Plan
Other duties as assigned by the Group Leader or Lab Director

BS degree in the sciences, engineering, or related field with laboratory experience.
Aerosol knowledge and experience is a plus.

Detail oriented, reliable, highly motivated, and will interact well in a team environment.
Working knowledge of fluid/aerosol flow and pressure.
Good organizational skills, a high energy level, a sense of commitment to assure that obligations and quality are met

Description: A2LA is a non-profit, public service membership organization offering compliance and accreditation services to organizations all over the world. A2LA is dedicated to formally recognizing testing, calibration and other laboratories and related organizations for their quality and technical competency with a variety of international standards (ISO/IEC 17025, ISO 15189, etc.), federal requirements (FDA, GLP, FCC, etc.), state (cannabis, etc.), and local requirements (water testing, etc.).

The Role
A2LA is seeking a results-driven and engaging professional to develop captivating content and build brand awareness by working closely with our marketing team. This is an exceptional opportunity to grow within a global non-profit organization as a Content Marketing Specialist. This position will report directly to the Marketing Manager.
About You
You are someone who is passionate about marketing trends and thrives in a fast-paced environment. You have proven excellent communication skills and know how to manage your time effectively. You are someone who enjoys developing content strategies through print and digital marketing while working on a team. You are self-motivated especially good at turning technical information into reader-friendly stories with personality.
Responsibilities


Manage list building, persona development, and creative messaging.
Oversee campaign execution, producing fresh content, and monitoring analytics.
Take the lead on drafting communications materials for campaigns, contributing to blog posts, podcasts, press releases, e-letters, and social media posts.
Stay current on the latest marketing news trends through various continuing education outlets and following relevant resources.
Write, edit, and proof other content as needed to ensure consistency in quality, style, and brand voice across the business.
Work closely with digital marketing and graphic design to produce assets that are SEO-friendly, visually appealing, and on-brand.
Proactively share best practices and expertise with the marketing team.
Perform other duties as assigned.

. Requirements: A2LA may provide exceptions to educational requirements for veterans who demonstrate the ability to perform the duties listed in this job posting.
A successful candidate for these positions typically meets the following criteria:


5+ years of proven experience with web design, graphic design, and creative/copywriting.
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or Journalism.
Ability to adapt writing style to engage the target audience.
Experience with Adobe Suite – InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Ability to translate communication strategy to internal teams.
Capacity to learn new platforms and tools quickly.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to learn A2LA services.

Benefits and Compensation
The salary for this position is commensurate with experience. In addition, A2LA offers a robust 403(b) retirement plan and benefits package including medical, dental, HSA, FSA (medical and dependent), life insurance, short- and long-term disability, employee assistance program (EAP), AFLAC, tuition reimbursement and other pre-taxed benefits, paid-time off, 10 paid government holidays, 1 floating holidays, training and development, career advancement opportunities and much more!
Working Environment & Physical Requirements
The physical demands and work environment described here reflect those of a person, in this position, will typically encounter.


Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to walk; sit for long hours, use fingers for typing; talk and hear. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision for reviewing documents on the computer or in hard copy state.
Work Environment: Work is typically performed in an office setting. Hours are flexible, but they should normally encompass at least the core hours of 9:00AM to 3:00PM, total at least forty (40) hours for each work week, and suit the needs of various training clients, where appropriate.
